item.title: Will Elastic Bandwidth Help Your Company?
item.description: Traditional telecom services such as T1 lines and SONET provided consistent bandwidth, but lacked flexibility. Today’s technology requires bandwidth that can adapt to changing needs. Enter “elastic bandwidth,” a service distinct from the variable bandwidth of DSL and Cable. While DSL and Cable’s performance depends on overall network traffic, elastic bandwidth empowers users to directly control their connection capacity. This allows for scaling bandwidth up or down in real-time. tw telecom’s Dynamic Capacity service exemplifies this by allowing users to adjust bandwidth instantly via a self-service portal, even scheduling changes in advance.

item.title: Bandwidth For Data Center Consolidation
item.description: Businesses are constantly looking for ways to cut costs without sacrificing quality, and increasing efficiency is a great way to do that. While you might believe you’ve maximized your data center efficiency, there might be untapped potential. Many organizations evolve organically, starting small and expanding over time through growth, acquisitions, and mergers. This often leads to a patchwork system of data centers, each designed for specific needs. However, as circumstances change, inefficiencies creep in.

item.title: How To Deal With Sudden Massive Bandwidth Demands
item.description: For years, you experience consistent, though gradually increasing, network bandwidth needs. Then, unexpectedly, you’re hit with a demand to increase your WAN bandwidth by 10x or even 100x. How does this happen, and how can you handle such unpredictable situations? It’s unlikely everyone in the company suddenly started downloading HD movies, right? While that would certainly max out your bandwidth, it’s not a realistic scenario. Bandwidth demands don’t surge without reason.
